verbs.description: shirr (third-person singular simple present shirrs, present participle shirring, simple past and past participle shirred)

entries.meaning: (US, sewing) To make gathers in textiles by drawing together parallel threads.
(US, transitive) To bake (a raw egg removed from its shell) in a baking dish.
examples: But her favorite way to express their simplicity is to shirr them. It's an old-fashioned technique that essentially means baking an egg. In her version, the eggs in ramekins are simmered in seasoned cream that reduces slightly into a soft sauce.
